page.title: 02A LIFETIME IN UTTOXETER
page.content: Mrs. Whitehead was born in Smithfield Road in 1907. She remembers a German airship over her house in the 1st World War. Her father worked at Bamfords.When he returned he set up a factory band to advertise Bamfords. She remembers going outside to see the first car.She thought it was amazing.On bank holidays her family went on picnics in a horse drawn carriage called a brake. The biggest changes for her are gas,electricity and travel. She had to collect firewood for her family and pump water. For many years Bamfords used a 'blower' to say it was time for work. Everyone in town used it to tell the time. For a while she walked to school from Bramshall. Sometimes they would run after the milk cart and jump o the back for a lift.Now it would be too dangerous for children.
